title: Highest GNI per Capita
description: In 2015, Liechtenstein had the highest Gross National Income per capita in the world, reaching $137,688.92 (constant 2015 US$).

title: Exceptional Political Stability
description: As of 2023, Liechtenstein ranks in the 94.79th percentile for political stability and absence of violence, indicating a highly stable political environment.

title: World's Lowest Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Secondary Education
description: In 2017, Liechtenstein had the lowest pupil-teacher ratio in lower secondary education globally, with just 5.6 students per teacher.

title: Leading in Research and Development
description: With 18,130 researchers per million people in 2023, Liechtenstein boasts one of the highest concentrations of researchers globally.

title: Negative Foreign Direct Investment Inflows
description: In 2018, Liechtenstein experienced a significant negative foreign direct investment inflow, amounting to -1303.11% of GDP.

title: Small Urban Population
description: As of 2023, Liechtenstein's urban population is relatively small, with only 5,825 people residing in urban areas.

title: High Sex Ratio at Birth
description: In 2023, Liechtenstein had a sex ratio at birth of 1.163 male births per female birth, which is higher than the global average.
